p: We address the question of whether R 0 can be estimated from the SPV characteristics θ ∈ { m, CV( SPV), σ( SPV), Sk( SPV)}; see Fig 8. The linear relationship between β and R 0 follows from Eq (16). In Fig 8(d), we once again observe that ( E, V) pairs with m > 10 have low R 0. As observed in case study 2, this is more an artefact of biases in the real data than a general trend. In Fig 8(b), we plot σ( SPV) against R 0. Although σ( SPV) does not directly affect R 0, we see this shape due to the relationship in the data between β and σ( SPV).
